text:
Meghan Markle and Prince Harry discuss engagement ring

Prince Harry, 33, is often jet-setting around the world, having travelled to the French Riviera and Northern Ireland this year, as well as a secret location for his honeymoon. He will also visit Australia, New Zealand, Fiji and Tonga later this year on his first royal tour with Meghan as a married couple. However, Harry also went on a secret trip earlier this year to Botswana, a country special to the pair. The royal decided to go without his new wife, however, as Meghan did not join him on the trip.

The Duke of Sussex is on a private working trip to Botswana Kensington Palace

A Kensington Palace spokeswoman told ITV: “The Duke of Sussex is on a private working trip to Botswana, to join the annual general meeting for Rhino Conservation Botswana in his capacity as patron. “He attended the board meeting in Maun and an RCB community project in Xarakao village." The secret trip was not disclosed at the time, although he was thought to have visited in August. It was suggested by royal correspondent Omid Scobie that it was the second time the royal had travelled to the region this year. He may have decided against taking Meghan seeing as it was a business trip as Patron of the Rhino Conservation Botswana, who work to protect black and white rhinos.

Prince Harry: The royal travelled abroad on a secret trip without Meghan Markle

While Meghan did not join him on his trip, the pair spent a romantic holiday there before their engagement, when he whisked her to the country on their third date. He said in the BBC interview: “I managed to persuade her to come and join me in Botswana. We camped out with each other under the stars. “She came and joined me for five days out there, which was absolutely fantastic. “So then we were really by ourselves, which was crucial to me to make sure that we had a chance to know each other.” They also visited the country to celebrate Meghan’s 36th birthday last year.
